meanings.definition: The quality or state of being viscous or sticky.
meanings.sent1: The viscidity of the honey made it difficult to pour.
meanings.sent2: The viscidity of the glue made it perfect for sticking things together.
meanings.sent3: The viscidity of the slime toy entertained the kids for hours.
meanings.sent4: The viscidity of the situation made it hard to escape the sticky mess.
meanings.sent5: The viscidity of the syrup was so thick that it clung to the spoon.

meanings.definition: The property of having a thick, sticky consistency.
meanings.sent1: She noticed the viscidity of the mud as she tried to walk through it.
meanings.sent2: The viscidity of the caramel sauce made it perfect for drizzling over desserts.
meanings.sent3: The viscidity of the bubblegum caused quite a sticky situation in class.
meanings.sent4: The viscidity of the traffic jam made it impossible to move forward.
meanings.sent5: The viscidity of the paint made it challenging to spread evenly on the canvas.
